title: What is the process of transforming the seed into the Golden Flower in Taoist alchemy?
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the transformation of the seed into a force and the attainment of eternal life through the fusion of the "fou co-luce" with the abysmal element. The purpose of the operation is to overcome existential fragmentation and reach the origin of being-life. The author clarifies that the text provides a concrete basis for this transformation in both cases, whether it occurs directly or indirectly through an operation with a woman. The author explains that the transformed seed converts into energy, and an essential state change occurs in the organism's vital energy. The text describes the birth of the Kuei, an active divine being, and the creation of a "Golden Genius" from the six-fold form. The new man, born through the process, is incorruptible, and death dissolves into life, creating a "body of life" capable of leaving the common body behind.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the process of transforming the conscious spirit into the "Genio d'Oro" or "Golden Genius" leads to the creation of a "body of life," detached from the physical body and capable of transcending the senses. Signs of the incipient crystallization of the "Fiore d'Oro" include a special serenity, natural resilience, and a clear perception of infinite clarity. This process ultimately dissolves the fear of death and generates a sense of lightness and levitation.
